title: Would it be bad if evolving intelligent life was just way too successful? - Quora

response.answer_text: There is that idea that “intelligent life” may indeed be self-limiting. That’s the “Fermi Paradox”….. The notion that at some point, a technological species is likely to destroy itself, if not by war and advanced weapons, by overpopulation and runaway pollution. Of course, by definition, an intelligent species would have the option of engaging in peaceful, cooperative behavior and building a clean and self-sustaining planet…….
